bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Foster Kennedy, August 8, 1946

div1.p: Hench apologizes for not visiting Kennedy when he was in New York, but he was too busy with his medical meetings. However, he did meet with Houston Lazear, who provided additional information about his father, Jesse Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Foster Kennedy, August 8, 1946
div1.opener:
August 8, 1946
Dr. Foster Kennedy
14 Sutter Square
New York, New York
My dear Dr. Kennedy:
div1.p:
Many weeks ago you and I had a brief correspondence about a
yellow fever item that had come into your possession. I had hoped
to be able to visit you briefly when I was in New York in June, but
I was so busy attending medical meetings that I wasn't able to.
Last month I went to the American Medical Association meeting,
stayed at the Mark Hopkins for a week and then went to El Encanto
at Santa Barbara for five days' rest with Mrs. Hench. The second
or third day we were there, we ran into Dr. and Mrs. Fitz and were
with them at a luncheon at one of the beach clubs. My wife noticed
there two people whom she remembered having seen at the hotel in
San Francisco and also at El Encanto. She noticed Dr. Fitz speaking
to them and asked who they were.

Undoubtedly you are away ahead of me. That couple were you
and Mrs. Kennedy. Unfortunately my wife did not tell me until
later that afternoon. I was so disappointed not to know that you
were there and not to have been able to meet you. I tried to phone
you at the home of one of your friends in Santa Barbara, but was
informed that you had just left, I believe for Los Angeles. I am
especially sorry that we did not meet, as in Santa Barbara I saw
Houston Lazear, the son of Dr. Lazear, a yellow fever fan. Houston
knew very little about his father and I had the privilege of telling
him things he had never heard. It is a shame that you, in your
interest in the conquest of yellow fever, did not have the opportunity
of meeting them.

I sincerely hope that the next time I am in New York, I will
have the opportunity to call on you.
div1.closer: Sincerely, Philip S. Hench, M. D. psh:gmh
